sentences.en: Additional studies and tests have tended to validate this conclusion.
sentences.cn: 进一步的研究和试验曾有助于确认这个结论.

sentences.en: Click OK to download the complete message and validate the signature.
sentences.cn: 请点击确定以下载整个消息以验证签名.

sentences.en: In order to validate the agreement, both parties sign it.
sentences.cn: 为使协议有效, 双方在上面签了字.

sentences.en: Many scientists plan to wait until the results of the study are validated by future research.
sentences.cn: 许多科学家计划等到调查结果被今后的研究证实了以后再作定论。

sentences.en: Please wait while we connect and validate the information you have provided.
sentences.cn: 请稍候,我们正在连接和验证您提供的信息.

sentences.en: Simulation results for the application in inverted pendulum validate this control algorithm.
sentences.cn: 在倒立摆系统中应用的仿真结果验证了该方法的有效性.

sentences.en: The Academy Awards appear to validate his career.
sentences.cn: 奥斯卡金像奖似乎是对他事业的肯定。

sentences.en: The experimental results validate the analysis conclusions of the converter.
sentences.cn: 通过充电机样机实验,验证了对变换器拓扑的分析结论.

sentences.en: The experimental results validate the theoretical simulation very well.
sentences.cn: 实验结果与理论模拟相一致.

sentences.en: The Supreme Court has validated the lower court’s interpretation of the law.
sentences.cn: 最高法院已经认可下级法院对这条法规的阐释。

sentences.en: The ticket has to be stamped by the airline to validate it.
sentences.cn: 须经航空公司盖章,该机票才能生效.

sentences.en: They wanted to validate their rules instead of just playing by them.
sentences.cn: 他们想证实这些原则,而不是盲目地根据原则交易.

sentences.en: This discovery seems to validate the claims of popular astrology.
sentences.cn: 这个发现似乎能印证流行占星术的一些说法。

sentences.en: This passport has to be signed before the official can validate it.
sentences.cn: 这个护照必须先行签署,官方才能确认其有效.

sentences.en: To validate your e - mail address, click on the link below.
sentences.cn: 若要验证您的电子邮件地址, 请单击下面的链接.

sentences.en: You need an official signature to validate the order.
sentences.cn: 你要有正式的签字,这张汇票才能生效.

words.tran_cn: 有效的，有根据的；正当的
确认（validate的过去式及过去分词形式）；使生效

trans.tran_en: to prove that something is true or correct, or to make a document or agreement officially and legally acceptable

trans.tran_cn: 使合法化，使有法律效力，使生效，批准，确认，证实
trans.tran_en: to prove that something is true or correct, or to make a document or agreement officially and legally acceptable
